qas.question: What part of the mine shaft requires routine testing?
What type of testing is done to the an area of the cable?
What is  the first step in destructive testing?

answers.text: The ends of the segment are frayed, then set in conical zinc molds

qas.question: Afterwards, what type of machine is the segment secured in?
What types of information are collected in the process?

answers.text: Data about elasticity, load, and other factors is compiled

context: Safety testing of mine shaft <a0_0>elevator rails<a0_0/> is routinely undertaken. The method involves <a1_0>destructive testing<a1_0/> of a segment of the cable. <a2_0>The ends of the segment are frayed, then set in conical zinc molds<a2_0/>. Each end of the segment is then secured in a large, <a3_0>hydraulic stretching machine<a3_0/>. The segment is then placed under increasing load to the point of failure. <a4_0>Data about elasticity, load, and other factors is compiled<a4_0/> and a report is produced. The report is then analyzed to determine whether or not the entire rail is safe to use.
